alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:16PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Douglas, Arapahoe and south central Denver Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 415 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from 6 miles south of Byers to Centennial, or along a line extending from 38 miles northwest of Limon to 10 miles south of Denver. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Locations impacted include... Denver, Aurora, Centennial, eastern Highlands Ranch, northwestern Parker, Greenwood Village, Lone Tree, Bennett, Byers, Buckley SFB, Arapahoe Park and Strasburg. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern and east central Colorado.
